rComments: The midterm and final (especially final) were pretty brutal if you aren't an excellent writer. Also, his slides are mostly pictures, so if you skip class and try to catch up later, it will not work.

I really recommend his class! Or any of his classes! He's very funny and makes his lectures easy to remember because he presents it in a really easy to understand way that is fun too! I loved this class I honestly would take it again, just attend class and take notes and you'll do well! He's really great loved loved loveddd this class

Awesome teacher. He uses pop culture references to help you understand the material. The class is only hard if you do not go to lecture. Do NOT buy the book, everything is online, but a lot of printing involved for section. His essays are a little hard, but none the less doable. (He likes war reenactments a lot by the way which is awesome!!)

History 2B was a great class; Greg O'Malley is a young professor, who is very well spoken and is very knowledgable in what he has to offer.  As far as exams go.  Focus on IDs that he covers in every lecture as those are the main focus on the exams.  Also, just prepare for essays as he gives you the prompts of essay for the exam, before the exam.

O'Malley is by far my favorite professor I've had at ucsc so far. I'm not a history major,had no clue what to expect. 2 papers, a midterm and a final. not too bad. The class covers a wide range of history but O'Malley made it fun and interesting to listen to. He's young and confident which made the class go so much smoother! take his class,

I took this class for lower div and I was bored with the slides he was showing. I am a history major and I thought his jokes were really funny but I almost fell asleep a couple of times in lecture. His exams are blue book and take a while to prepare for. but overall a caring professor.
o'malley is organized, knows his stuff, and best of all, he's hilarious. take his class if you get the cahnce. you'll learn a lot and have fun
Awesome enthusiasm for the subject and the students! Also made lectures interesting with humor and also good research.

He is one of my favorite professors at UCSC. His obvious interest in the classes he teaches is infectious and he makes learning really fun. I would recommend anyone to take a class with him! p.s. He is really cute! :)
One of the best new professors at UCSC. Makes good use of power point presentations. Extremely likable. Highly recommended even for non-history or American Studies majors

Prof. O'Malley has become one of my favorite professors at UCSC. I highly recommend his American Revolution class. He has a goofy sense of humor, and is so relaxed and approachable. But his lectures were still incredibly interesting, and his readings were excellent and applicable. Definitely take a class with him!
O'Malley is one of my favorite professors at UCSC!

Professor O'Malley has a wonderfully refreshing approach to serious academic study without the rigid norms of the field. His expectations are crystal clear and his reading selections were mostly excellent. Great new addition to UCSC!

Greg is great and will certainly be a wonderful addition to the UCSC community.He is approachable and unpretentious. He always seemed more than happy to assist students with their research and writing. I would highly recommend him for 190X, The Atlantic World, overall a great class.

This class was so much fun! Prof. O'Malley has an awkward sense of humor but it's really endearing~ I was first thrown off because he talks like a regular college student- very casual and laid back, but the way he pushed the class' same old white collegiate liberal ideas was refreshing and he had lots of interesting things to say. :)

O'Malley is a wonderful teacher.  His race in us history class is one my favorites I have taken at UCSC.  He is approachable, funny, and extremely knowledgeable in his field.  He is truly an amazing teacher and I would HIGHLY recommend taking a class from him!
